greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of r(q) * s(q) in powers of q where r(), s() are cubic AGM functions.
comment: Cubic AGM theta functions: r(q) (see A004016), s(q) (A005928), t(q) (A005882).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (terms 0..5000 from G. C. Greubel)
formula: Convolution of the sequences A004016 and A005928.
The g.f. is the product of the g.f.'s for A004016 and A005928. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 30 2017
Expansion of eta(q)^3 * (eta(q)^3 + 9 * eta(q^9)^3) / eta(q^3)^2 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (9 t)) = 81 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A144614.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ q]^3 (QPochhammer[ q]^3 + 9 q QPochhammer[ q^9]^3) / QPochhammer[ q^3]^2, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, my(A = x * O(x^n)); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^3 * (eta(x + A)^3 + 9 * x * eta(x^9 + A)^3) / eta(x^3 + A)^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 28 2017
